title: Case study: IOTN
text: ‘grantpubcite’ package can used query NIH Reporter database funded grants, publications associated grants. citation history publications can discovered using iCite. case study look Immuno-Oncology Translational Network (IOTN), consortium supported NIH Cancer Moonshot accelerate translation basic discoveries clinical applications improve immunotherapy outcomes.

title: Case study: IOTN
text: See Introduction ‘grantpubcite’ article installation, basic use, brief introduction ‘tidyverse’ operations. Load library packages used case study. document written Rmarkdown; code chunks used generate table figure can shown toggling ‘Details’ widget.
code: library(grantpubcite) library(ggplot2) library(DT)

title: Case study: IOTN
text: Funding Opportunity Announcements IOTN follows: Discover projects funded FOAs querying NIH Reporter, use information returned query summarize projects. 35 projects. projects include large U54, resource sharing management centers, well U01 UG3 awards.
code: foas <- tribble(     ~full_foa,       ~tag,      ~description,     "RFA-CA-19-044", "U01",     "Advancing Cancer Immunotherapy by Mitigating Immune-Related Adverse Events (irAE) (U01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)",      "RFA-CA-19-012", "UG3/UH3", "Immuno-Oncology Translation Network (IOTN): Cancer Immunoprevention Research Projects (UG3/UH3 Clinical Trials Not Allowed)",     "RFA-CA-19-013", "U54",     "Immuno-Oncology Translation Network (IOTN): Immuno-engineering to Improve Immunotherapy (i3) Centers (U54 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)",     "RFA-CA-19-014", "U01",     "Immuno-Oncology Translation Network (IOTN): Cancer Immunoprevention Research Projects (U01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)",     "RFA-CA-19-015", "U01",     "Immuno-Oncology Translation Network (IOTN): Cancer Immunotherapy Research Projects (U01 Clinical Trial Not Allowed)",      "RFA-CA-17-045", "U01",     "Immuno-Oncology Translation Network (IOTN): Cancer Immunotherapy Research Projects (U01)",     "RFA-CA-17-046", "U01",     "Immuno-Oncology Translation Network (IOTN): Cancer Immunoprevention Research Projects (U01)",     "RFA-CA-17-047", "DMRC",    "Immuno-Oncology Translation Network (IOTN): Data Management and Resource-Sharing Center (DMRC) (U24)",     "RFA-CA-17-048", "CIDR",    "Immuno-Oncology Translation Network (IOTN): Cellular Immunotherapy Data Resource (CIDR) (U24)" ) |>     mutate(         tag = factor(tag, levels = c("UG3/UH3", "U01", "DMRC", "CIDR", "U54"))     ) project_summary <- program_projects(foas) plot <-     project_summary |>     left_join(foas, by = "full_foa") |>     ggplot(aes(tag, award_amount)) +     scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +     geom_boxplot(outlier.color = NA) +     geom_jitter() +     xlab("Funding type") + ylab("Amount ($)")

title: Case study: IOTN
text: Publications associated projects discovered using NIH Reporter. Citations iCite. 424 publications. Project U01DK124165 important publication PMID 32839624. 10% publications involved collaboration projects; one publication represented extensive collaboration. figure shows publications per year…  …distribution citations per publication  Project-level citations summarized number publications, total citation count, sum ‘relative citation index’, measure provided iCite standardizing impact publications year field study. relationship amount funding relative citation ratio show figure ; mousing points shows underlying data associated core project number. Large ‘U54’ projects emphasize publication.
code: program_publications <- program_publications(foas)  publications <-     program_publications |>     select(-c("full_foa", "core_project_num")) |>     distinct() |>     arrange(desc(citation_count))  publications_per_project <-     program_publications |>     count(core_project_num, name = "n_pub") |>     left_join(project_summary, by = "core_project_num") |>     select(-c("full_foa", "project_title", "fiscal_year")) |>     arrange(desc(n_pub))  collaboration_summary <-     program_publications |>     count(pmid, name = "n_collaborators") |>     count(n_collaborators, name = "n_publications") plot <-     publications |>     ggplot(aes(factor(year))) +     geom_bar() +     xlab("Year") + ylab("Number of publications") plot <-     publications |>     filter(citation_count > 0) |>     ggplot(aes(citation_count)) +     scale_x_log10() +     geom_density() +     xlab("Number of citations") + ylab("Number of publications") citations_by_project <-     program_publications |>     group_by(core_project_num) |>     summarize(         n_pub = n(),         n_citn = sum(citation_count),         total_rcr = sum(relative_citation_ratio, na.rm = TRUE)     ) |>     left_join(project_summary, by = "core_project_num") |>     arrange(desc(total_rcr)) plot <-     citations_by_project |>     ggplot(         aes(             award_amount, total_rcr,             text = paste0(core_project_num, ": ", gpc_shorten(project_title))         )     ) +     geom_point() +     scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +     xlab("Award amount ($)") +     ylab("Total relative citation ratio")

title: Case study: ITCR
text: unique aspect ITCR FOA structure envisions projects starting one FOA ‘maturing’ next FOA, e.g., Early-Stage U01 matures Advanced U24. possible assess tracking project number full FOA, project number changes FOA. projects contact PI received awards different FOA tags? Direct inspection suggests following transitions:
code: tagged_pis <-     projects |>     distinct(full_foa, project_title, contact_pi_name) |>     left_join(foas, by = "full_foa") |>     select(foa_tag, contact_pi_name) |>     distinct()  maturing_pis <-     tagged_pis |>     count(contact_pi_name, sort = TRUE) |>     filter(n > 1L) |>     select(-n) |>     left_join(         projects |>         distinct(full_foa, core_project_num, contact_pi_name, project_title),         by = "contact_pi_name",         multiple = "all"     ) |>     left_join(foas, by = "full_foa") |>     select(contact_pi_name, project_title, foa_tag) |>     arrange(contact_pi_name, project_title, foa_tag)

title: Case study: ITCR
text: prolific projects large number publications reported projects ‘U01CA239055’ ‘U01CA248226’ apparently software tools developed group immediately useful completing projects image analysis center. relationship publication funding amount visualized follows.
code: publications_by_project <-     publications |>     count(core_project_num, sort = TRUE, name = "n_publ") |>     left_join(         projects |>         select(core_project_num, contact_pi_name, project_title, award_amount),         by = "core_project_num"     ) plot <-     publications_by_project |>     ggplot(aes(         award_amount, n_publ,         text = paste0(core_project_num, ": ", gpc_shorten(project_title))     )) +     geom_point() +     geom_smooth(         method = "lm", formula = y ~ x,         inherit.aes = FALSE, aes(award_amount, n_publ)     ) +     scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +     labs(x = "Total funding ($)", y = "Number of publications")

title: Case study: ITCR
text: ITCR emphasizes collaboration funded projects. examples collaboration level publication, .e., pmid associated one project number? projects collaborating shared publication? Relationships can visualized network graph. Hover nodes see project number title. width edges proportional square root number co-publications; dashed lines indicate single copublication. strongest relationships ‘self-copublicaton’ grants PI institution.
code: collaborative_publications <-     publications |>     count(pmid, sort = TRUE, name = "n_collab") |>     filter(n_collab > 1) |>     left_join(         publications |>         select(-c("full_foa", "core_project_num")) |>         distinct(),         by = "pmid"     ) collaborative_projects <-     copublication(foas) |>     left_join(         projects |> select(core_project_num, contact_pi_name, project_title),         by = "core_project_num"     ) |>     arrange(desc(collab)) copub_data <- copublication_data(foas) nodes <-     copub_data |>     tidyr::pivot_longer(dplyr::starts_with("core_project_num")) |>     distinct(id = value) |>     left_join(         projects |> select(id = "core_project_num", project_title) |> distinct(),         by = "id"     ) |>     mutate(         size = 10,         title = paste0(id, ": ", .data$project_title)     )  edges <-     copub_data |>     mutate(         from = core_project_num.x,         to = core_project_num.y,         width = 3 * sqrt(n),         smooth = FALSE,         dashes = n == 1L     )  copub_network <-     visNetwork(nodes, edges) |>     ## set random seed for reproducibility     visLayout(randomSeed = 123)

code: cocite_data <- cocitation_data(foas)  ## ITCR publications ... cocite_data |>     distinct(pmid) |>     NROW() #> [1] 860 ## ... cited by other ITCR publications cocite_data |>     distinct(cited_by) |>     NROW() #> [1] 1103 ## ITCR projects cocite_data |>     distinct(core_project_num) |>     NROW() #> [1] 102 ## ... cited by other ITCR projects cocite_data |>     distinct(cited_by_core_project_num) |>     NROW() #> [1] 115  ## pmid / cited_by pairs total_citations <- NROW(cocite_data)  ## self-citations core_project_num_self_citations <-     cocite_data |>     count(self_citation = core_project_num == cited_by_core_project_num) |>     filter(self_citation) |>     pull(n) cocitation <-     cocitation(foas) |>     arrange(desc(n_self_citn))

title: Case study: specific projects
text: Suppose one interested specific projects, grant project numbers known. Define search . Query NIH Reporter projects interest. use project_nums= argument required reflection API schema provided end API projects endpoint. Explore data, instance finding Funding Opportunity Announcement grants reward , fiscal years active.
code: project_nums <- c("U01CA190234", "U24CA194354") projects <- reporter_projects(project_nums = project_nums) projects |>     group_by(core_project_num) |>     summarize(         foa = unique(full_foa),         first_year = min(fiscal_year),         last_year = max(fiscal_year),         project_title = unique(project_title)     ) |>     gpc_datatable()

title: Case study: specific projects
text: Use core project numbers retrieve known publications number publications associated grant follows: Many publications attributed grants
code: core_project_nums <-     pull(projects, "core_project_num") |>     unique() publications <- reporter_publications(core_project_nums = core_project_nums) publications |>     count(coreproject) |>     gpc_datatable() publications |>     count(pmid, name = "cited_by") |>     count(cited_by) |>     gpc_datatable()

title: Case study: specific projects
text: Obtain citation information (including information orginal publication) using publications tibble 60 citation records, one publication. Explore interactively Use ‘join’ tables associate publications citations
code: citations <- icite(publications) citations |>     select(pmid, citation_count, relative_citation_ratio, year, title) |>     gpc_datatable() left_join(publications, citations) |>     group_by(coreproject, year) |>     summarize(         n_publications = n(),         total_citations = sum(citation_count)     ) |>     gpc_datatable() #> Joining with `by = join_by(pmid)` #> `summarise()` has grouped output by 'coreproject'. You can override using the #> `.groups` argument.

title: Introduction to 'grantpubcite'
text: reporter_projects() queries ‘projects’ endpoint; see technical description NIH Reporter project search API details, paying particular attention ‘schema’ present executable example.. illustration start identifying Funding Opportunity Announcemments (FOA) might interest, case current FOA Information Technology Cancer Research (ITCR) program. Use reporter_projects() providing criteria used query NIH Reporter projects endpoint. criteria provided named arguments reporter_projects(). query projects awarded FOA interest, use argument foa =. Initially, use limit = 1 argument retrieve just single record. shows return value reporter_projects() tibble (tidyverse representation data.frame) single row corresponding requested record, possible fields returned query. Inspect fields might interest, define variable reference . Now execute reporter_projects() query FOA interest, including fields interest response.

what: Query NIH Reporter and iCite for Grant and Publication Information
title: Query NIH Reporter and iCite for Grant and Publication Information
text: ‘grantpubcite’ package used query NIH Reporter database funded grants , optionally, publications associated grants NIH Reporter. citation history publications can discovered using iCite. ‘grantpubcite’ package help pages resources make extensive use ‘tidyverse’ concepts. Install development version grantpubcite github. Load library packages used vignette. See Get started introduction package. Case study: ITCR illustration package use analysing grants NIH Information Technology Cancer Research portfolio grants. ITCR particularly interesting ’s focus ‘dry-lab’ technology / software, multi-year duration, sequence grants representing progression small grants emphasizing innovation large grants sustain essential resources. Case study: IOTN looks NIH NCI Immuno-Oncology Translation Network portfolio grants; IOTN servers interesting ‘wet-lab’ comparison ITCR. Case study: specific projects provides quick explorartion publications citations arising two related grants. Implementation notes provides brief notes implementation, highligth great packages & people contributing indirectly package. Please note experienced sort analysis, conclusions viewed great skepticism.
code: if (!nzchar(system.file(package = "remotes")))     install.package("remotes", repos = "https://cran.r-project.org") remotes::install_github("mtmorgan/grantpubcite") library(grantpubcite)

title: Program project collaboration through publication and citation — copublication_data
text: copublication_data() returns tibble enumerating pmid acknowledging one project. copublication() summarizes collaboration projects time publication. cocitation_data() returns tibble enumerating pmid cited program pmid. cocitation() summarizes collaborations projects citation.

title: Program project collaboration through publication and citation — copublication_data
code: copublication_data(tbl)  copublication(tbl)  cocitation_data(tbl)  cocitation(tbl)

title: Program project collaboration through publication and citation — copublication_data
text: tbl tibble column full_foa containing Funding Opportunity Announcements defining projects interest.

title: Program project collaboration through publication and citation — copublication_data
text: copublication_data() returns tibble following columns. core_project_num.x, core_project_num.y: character() pairwise project collaboration. n: intger() number collaborations projects. copublication() returns tibble columns core_project_num: character() project numbers involved collaboration n: integer() total number publications project. citn: integer() total number citations project publications. rcr: numeric() total relative citation rate project publications. collab: integer() number distinct collaborators, across collaborative publications. n_collab: integer() number collaborative publications. citn_collab: numeric() total 'citation_count' collaborative publications. rcr_collab: numeric() total 'relative citation ratio' collaborative publications. cocitation_data() returns tibble following columns. pmid: integer() pmid original publication. cited_by: integer() pmid publication citing original publication. core_project_num: character() project number project acknowledged original publication. cited_by_core_project_num: character() project number project citing original publication. cocitation() returns tibble columns project: character() project number associated publications. n: integer() total number publications project. citn: integer() total number citations project publications. rcr: numeric() total relative citation rate project publications. n_self_citn: integer() number citations publications project. n_collab_citn: integer() number publications cited projects. n_collab: integer() total number projects citing project. rcr_citn: numeric() total 'relative citation ratio' collaborative cited publications.

what: Utilities for 'grantpubcite' use in articles — gpc_camelize
title: Utilities for 'grantpubcite' use in articles — gpc_camelize
text: gpc_camelize() takes input 'snake_case' vector transforms CamelCase. gpc_columns_clean() used internally ensure consistent column formatting. gpc_colnames_standardize() transforms column names shorter equivalents, primary useful (horizontal) contraction table displays. gpc_datatable() standardizes column names consistent display. non-interactive sessions returned DT::datatable() interactive navigation. gpc_datatable_download() adds download buttons tables gpc_short_title() shortens titles, e.g., use labels interactive plots.

title: Utilities for 'grantpubcite' use in articles — gpc_camelize
code: gpc_camelize(x)  gpc_columns_clean(.data)  gpc_colnames_standardize(.data = NULL)  gpc_datatable(.data, truncate_columns = TRUE, width = 40L)  gpc_datatable_download(.data, truncate_columns = FALSE, width = 40L)  gpc_shorten(x, to = 40L)

title: Utilities for 'grantpubcite' use in articles — gpc_camelize
text: x character(), e.g., project_title truncated. .data tibble, usually invocation reporter_projects() icite(). .data can also NULL gpc_colnames_standardize(), case return value tibble summarizing column names '' reporter_projects() icite() translated '' display column names. truncate_columns logical(1) truncate long column names (default: TRUE)? width integer(1) number characters truncate ; remaining characters replaced '...'. integer(1) maximum number characters retain x.

title: Utilities for 'grantpubcite' use in articles — gpc_camelize
text: gpc_camelize() useful standardizing user interface API, input 'include_fields' CamelCase API, return values snake_case. Using gpc_camelize() (internally) allows user interact API using consistent snake_case style. gpc_columns_clean() performs following: Remove leading trailing whitespace 'character' columns. Coerce columns whose name ends _date .Date(). Coerce 'pmid', 'year' / 'fiscal year' 'citation_count' integer() Remove 'group' annotation tibbles created processing. gpc_datatable() convenience function used vignettes () standardize column names better formatting; (b) provides consistent presentation DT::datatable without rownames, pageLength 5, horizontal scrolling, means long tables overwhelm articles spill margins, (c) transforms table interactive. Articles typically use gpc_datatable() code chunk include = FALSE, user sees datatable code.

title: Utilities for 'grantpubcite' use in articles — gpc_camelize
Program-level queries and summaries — program_summary
text: program_summary() finds projects, publications, citations funded Funding Opportunity Announcements (FOAs) tbl, summarizes year number projects, total award ammount, publications, citation count, relative citation ratio. program_projects() returns tibble project numbers standardized contact PI name project title. program_publications() retrieves basic information projects program.

title: Program-level queries and summaries — program_summary
code: program_summary(tbl)  program_projects(tbl, by = c("foa", "project"))  program_publications(tbl)

title: Program-level queries and summaries — program_summary
text: tbl tibble column full_foa giving FOAs define program. character(1) indicating program projects summarized -- foa projects funded one FOA reported FOA, project summary project number across FOA.

title: Program-level queries and summaries — program_summary
text: program_summary() returns tibble ordered fiscal year summarizing project activity. Columns year: integer() year program. project: integer() number active projects. amount: integer() award amount active projects. publications: integer() number publications. cite: integer() citations publications year. rcr: numeric() sum relative citation ratios publications year. program_projects() returns tibble summarizing projects funded FOAs. = "full_foa" (default), columns : foa: character() full FOA funding project. project: character() core project number. start_date: date() start date project end_date: date() end date project; maybe future contact_pi: character() name -recent contact PI FOA core project number. title: character() project title. year: integer() fiscal years funding; may differ project duration (end date - start date. amount: integer() actual award amount across fiscal years. = "project", columns start_date, end_date, year, amount recent contact PI project title summarized FOAs project funded. program_publications() returns tibble columns: foa: character() full FOA funding project. project: character() core project number. pmid: integer() PubMed identifier. year, title, authors, journal,doi: publication information. citn: integer() number publicatons citing publication, icite(). rcr: relative citation ratio, defined icite(). fcr: field citation rate, defined icite().

title: Program-level queries and summaries — program_summary
text: program_summary() can return rows corresponding years years FOAs active. Values FOA activity usually represent grantee assigning credit FOA citation published prior start FOA, project funded FOAs included input tbl core project number funded project. Values end FOA represent publications acknowledge FOA termination grant. program_projects() provides single row project. chooses full_foa recent FOA project funded. chooses contact_pi_name project_title name contact PI project title largest award recent year funding.

code: reporter_projects(..., include_fields = NULL, limit = NULL, verbose = FALSE)  reporter_publications(..., limit = NULL, verbose = FALSE)  icite(tbl, include_fields = NULL, verbose = FALSE)

title: Query projects, publications and citations — reporter_projects
text: ... named arguments descrbing fields query. Values 'Schema' linked API description. include_fields character() fields include. default (null) returns available fields. limit integer(1) return maximum limit records matching search criteria. verbose logical(1) report JSON used search criteria, summary responses prior processing final tibble representation. tbl icite(), tbl must contain column pmid PubMed ids, instance tibble derived reporter_publications().

title: Query projects, publications and citations — reporter_projects
text: reporter_projects() returns tibble selected columns. Available columns described schema available API documentation page. reporter_publications() returns tibble columns coreproject, pmid, applid. icite() returns tibble columns defined include_fields.

title: Query projects, publications and citations — reporter_projects
text: NIH reporter API used reporter_projects() reporter_publications() documented https://api.reporter.nih.gov/. icite() API described https://icite.od.nih.gov/api.

title: grantpubcite v0.0.2
text: (v. 0.0.1.9001) Add gpc_*() helper functions standardize user API, processing reporter return values, shorten column names display. (v. 0.0.1.9001) Add program_() functions provide higher-level interface collecting program-level information projects publications. (v. 0.0.1.9001) Add copublication*() cocitation*() summarize project-level collaboratoin publication citation level. (v. 0.0.1.9001) improve datatable display ‘top’ vertical alignment cells, truncating text maximum 40 characters. (v. 0.0.1.9001) Update IOTN ITCR case studies use new functionality. (v 0.0.1.9002) add copublication_data() (v 0.0.1.9002) change return value columns copublication() collab: number collaborators, across publications n_collab: number collaborative publications citn_collab: total citation count collaborartive publications (v 0.0.1.9003) add co-publication network ITCR case study.

title: grantpubcite v0.0.1
text: (v. 0.0.1) Initial version. Don’t show case study code default, reports readble. (v. 0.0.0.9014) Add ‘Implementation notes’ share enabling sources. (v. 0.0.0.9012) Add IOTN case study. (v. 0.0.0.9012) Add ‘fnd’ (funding) role DESCRIPTION, acknowledging NIH NCI ITCR U24CA180996, additional minor changes articles. (v. 0.0.0.9011) Correct ‘Innovative’ / ‘Early-stage’ maturing order. (v. 0.0.0.9010) Update ‘Getting started’ link number projects mentioned summary ITCR case study. Thanks Juli Klemm. (v. 0.0.0.9009) Add missing FOAs (RFA-*) 2019+; now 146 grants evidence project maturation. Thanks Satish Viswanath pointing missing FOAs. (v. 0.0.0.9008) Add downloadable projects data. Thanks Andrey Fedorov comments leading preceeding change. (v. 0.0.0.9007) Add downloadable table ITCR publications / citations. Thanks Andrey Fedorov prompt. (v. 0.0.0.9006) Provide higher-level narrative summary ‘Case study: ITCR’ article. (v. 0.0.0.9005) Limit number results returned reporter_*() 10,000; larger result sets experience result mis-specification query criteria. (v. 0.0.0.9005) Add short article exploring specific project numbers. (v. 0.0.0.9005) Add NEWS.md file track changes package.
